channel.title: Today I learned (TIL) - Category - Automate everything
channel.description: Today I learned (TIL) - Category - Automate everything

item.title: How to Create Your Own Have I Been Pwned (HIBP) API Request With Python
item.author: Author
item.description: The idea is to create my own Python script performing REST API requests to the HIBP API to check if mail accounts or password show up in one of the latest breaches. And yes I was just bored and wanted to learn how to do API calls in Python.

item.title: How to reload your VSCode Window
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned how to reload/restart my window in Visual Studio Code.

This is especially helpful if you want to restart Visual Studio and leave all your current terminals open.

item.title: Hot and cold Crypto Wallet (Address)
item.author: Author
item.description: Today I learned how to explain the differences between a hot and cold crypto wallet and a wallet address.

item.title: Crypto Tokens, Coins and Mnemonics
item.author: Author
item.description: Today I learned to simply explain the difference between a crypto token, coin and a mnemonic.

item.title: Automatically clean up local once remote branch is deleted
item.author: Author
item.description: Use this nice PowerShell one-liner to automatically clean up (delete) your local branches once your remote branches is deleted (merged).

item.title: Clean Up and Sync Your Git Fork
item.author: Author
item.description: If you want to start with your fork from scratch while remaining the current upstream/main as your base use this.

item.title: Find and replace with a newline in Visual Studio Code
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned How to find and replace with a newline in Visual Studio Code.

In the local searchbox (Ctrl + F) you can insert newlines by pressing Ctrl + Enter.

item.title: Visual Studio Code Keyboard Shortcuts
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned Visual Studio Code Keyboard Shortcuts for Windows, macOs and Linux.

Visual Studio Code lets you perform most tasks directly from the keyboard. This page lists out the default bindings (keyboard shortcuts).

item.title: How to get a list of PowerShell Aliases
item.author: Author
item.description:
Today I learned How to get a list of PowerShell Aliases.

An alias is an alternate name for a cmdlet, function, executable file, including scripts. PowerShell includes a set of built-in aliases. You can add your own aliases to the current session and to your PowerShell profile.

item.title: How to install and update Azure PowerShell 7
item.author: Author
item.description: Let’s keep it easy with these one-liner’s you can use for Windows as well as Linux.
